artist: Attributed to Johann Friedrich Eberlein; Meissen Porcelain Factory
description: Meissen kakiemon 'fliegender hund' (flying dragon) pattern sauceboat. Molded at either end under each spout with a female mask wearing a feather headdress, the rims with Alt-Ozier molding, and the feet with puce-heightened scrolls.
text: The model for this sauce boat is attributed to Johann Friedrich Eberlein, who, along with Johann Joachim KÃ¤ndler, were the Meissen factory's finest designers. This sauce boat was first produced for a service for the Counts von Sulkowsky made from 1735 to 1737.
title: Sauce boat
